channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9301] Default hbase.dynamic.jars.dir to hbase.rootdir/jars
item.description: A reasonable default for hbase.dynamic.jars.dir would be hbase.rootdir/jars so that folks aren't forced to edit their hbase-sites.xml to take advantage of the new, cool feature to load coprocessor/custom filter jars out of HDFS.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Sound good to me!
is jars the right name? libs? You have a patch Mr Taylor?
Attached the patch files for 0.94 (0.94-HBASE-9301.patch) and trunk/0.96 (HBASE-9301.patch). The patch defaults hbase.dynamic.jars.dir to hbase.rootdir/lib

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12601489/HBASE-9301.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

+1
Going to commit today unless I hear objections.
Wouldn't a directory under rootdir/lib cause problems in 0.94, since hbck and master would treat as a table directory?
Hmm... Good call. Can we do .lib instead?
I guess we can. I think it is ok to use lib in 0.96 as well.
So ".lib" in 0.94 and "lib" in 0.96? Seems .lib everywhere might better.

lib vs .lib sounds like one more thing to add to the migration script. Is there not a solution with is compatible across releases? Since this is something we expect users to interact with, it's a de facto API.

Dare I ask about the complexity of making rootdir/lib a "special" directory in 0.94?
Should be doable. Easy to miss spots, though. Why not just make it ".lib" everywhere? Would be in line with ".log" ".archive", etc. Or did we drop the "." prefix in trunk and I missed it?

Or did we drop the "." prefix in trunk and I missed it?

Indeed. HBASE-9128
Enis Soztutar or Lars Hofhansl Can you please point me to the code/help me in understanding the issues that could arise because of rootdir/lib in 0.94? I am looking into HBaseFsck.

I see
Let's do ".lib" in 0.94 and "lib" in 0.96+ then.
Using the '.' is the way we do other dirs in 0.94, so I think we should keep it that way.

As Nick said, this is like an API, and the API is changed in many more significant from 0.94 to 0.96.

Vasu Mariyala Every directory under the hbase root dir is interpreted as an HBase table in 0.94 unless its name starts with a '.'

Let's do ".lib" in 0.94 and "lib" in 0.96+ then.

Sounds good. The only thing now is whether we want migration for the lib dir between 0.94 and 0.96. If so, we can add that to NamespaceUpgrade.migrateDotDirs().

It seems external software would need to be changed anyway, so migrating this makes less sense than the .logs directory. No harm moving it over, though.
Vasu Mariyala, do you have time to do that?
Yes, I would post the patch soon.

Attached the patch files 0.94-HBASE-9301-rev1.patch and HBASE-9301-rev1.patch. The behavior is hbase.dynamic.jars.dir defaults to .lib in 0.94 and to lib in 0.96 with the migration from 0.94 to 0.96 taken care by the NamespaceUpgrade.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12601948/HBASE-9301-rev1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

-1 tests included. The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1

James Taylor Let's make sure this is good for Phoenix.
Yep, this should be fine. Thanks for the patch, guys!
A'right, going to commit before 0.94.12.
